header.title: About Us
header.content: The Web Development and Consulting Club is Aotearoa New Zealand’s largest student technology club. Read more about our history, goals, and achievements - as well as the people that help make it all happen.

genInfo.firstPart: Founded in 2019, WDCC - the Web Development and Consulting Club - helps promote the learning and practice of software development and its related skills and activities.
genInfo.secondPart: We conduct workshops, events, and competitions, and organise real-world projects that help equip tomorrow’s talent.

image.alt: Two speakers with the WDCC banner behind them.

whyJoin.title: Why Join WDCC?
whyJoin.content:
WDCC (Web Development & Consulting Club Incorporated) is a not-for-profit organisation, founded by two students at the University of Auckland.

WDCC aims to bridge the gap between university knowledge and real-world industry practices. We run projects with real-world clients that solve real-world problems, generally for NFP organisations or other student clubs who don't have the funding to fund a solution themselves.

Projects could also be to develop own open-source tools to better support the development community. To help our members and the wider student community improve their skills and gain more benefits from the projects, we also hold workshops that help to upskill.

image.alt: A WDCC workshop with laptops in the foreground.

ourPeople.title: Our People
ourPeople.content: It's our people that make our events and goals happen, and help shape the character and personality of our club. This year, WDCC has 1106 members and 33 executives, making us the largest tech club in Aotearoa.

image.alt: The 2025 exec team, bending over a laptop.

quoteSection.quote: WDCC aims to bridge university knowledge with industry practices by offering real-world client projects, mainly with not-for-profits. Our events, including workshops, hackathons, competitions, and industry socials, cultivate a supportive community across diverse backgrounds. Through these initiatives, WDCC empowers students to explore tech careers and fosters connections within the industry.
quoteSection.author: Kimberley Zhu
